page.title: 07DORMITORY VILLAGES
page.content: THE VILLAGES OF KENN AND KENNFORD FORM DORMITORY VILLAGES FOR PEOPLE WORKING IN EXETER 5KMS AWAY. NUMEROUS PEOPLE COMMUTE EACH DAY TO THE CITY TO WORK. THE OPENING OF THE A38 AS A DUAL CARRIAGEWAY TO PLYMOUTH HAS GIVEN THE CHANCE FOR PEOPLE ALSO TO COMMUTE TO THIS CITY.THIS HAS MEANT THAT IT IS ALMOST NECESSARY FOR EACH FAMILY TO HAVE ITS OWN FORM OF PRIVATE TRANSPORT.PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS LACKING AND IS SOMETHING PEOPLE WOULD LIKE TO SEE IMPROVED.MANY PEOPLE PRAISE THE CAR,LORRY,MOTORCYCLE OR BUS, OTHERS CURSE THEM AS THEY CAUSE DISRUPTION TO A QUIET VILLAGE LIFE.CHILDREN OVER THE AGE OF 11 TRAVEL TO SCHOOL IN DAWLISH EITHER BY SCHOOL BUS OR PRIVATE CAR AS THE ONLY SCHOOL IN THE VILLAGES IS FOR CHILDREN BETWEEN 5 AND 10 YEARS OF AGE.
